title.narrative: Uganda: Roads and Bridges in the Refugee Hosting Districts/Koboko-Yumbe-Moyo Road Corridor Project

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity
Actual start date of the activity
Planned end date of the activity
Planned start date of the activity

mailing-address.narrative: The World Bank, 1818 H Street, NW, Washington, DC 20433 USA

description.narrative: Total Commitment in Third Quarter of 2020
Total Disbursement in First Quarter of 2021

condition.narrative: The Recipient shall prepare and furnish to the Association not later than March 31 of each Fiscal Year during the implementation ofthe Project (starting in Fiscal Year 2020-2021), a work plan and budget containing all activities proposed to be included in theProject during the following Fiscal Year, and a proposed financing plan (including the portion of Counterpart Funds to be provided)for expenditures required for such activities, setting forth the proposed amounts and sources of financing. (See Section 1.D.1 ofSchedule 2 to the Financing Agreement)

Without limitation upon the provisions of Section 5.03 of the General Conditions, the Recipient shall, in each Fiscal Year (“FY”)commencing FY2020/2021: (a) through UNRA, establish and thereafter maintain at all material times during the implementation of theProject, a budget line item for costs of land acquisition, resettlement and rehabilitation as well as for shifting utilities(Resettlement Activities) under Part 1(d) of the Project; and (b) through Ministry of Finance and Economic Planning, allocate aportion of Counterpart Funds required for said Resettlement Activities under said Part 1(d) of the Project as indicated in therespective Annual Work Plan and Budget. (See Section 1.E.7(a) of Schedule 2 to the Financing Agreement)

title.narrative: Local labor among unskilled employment created under the works contracts (dis-aggregated by gender, refugees, hosts)

target.value: 40 percent of total labor (Number of workers)

title.narrative: Percentage of Project Affected People that received full compensation and all R&R assistance dis-aggregated by gender, refugees, hosts
Percentage increase in employment of women (those in refugee camps of Bidi Bidi, Lobule, and Palorinya)
Annual number of fatalities or serious injuries involving construction vehicles or at construction sites
Grievances responded and/or resolved within the stipulated service standards for response times (dis-aggregated by gender, refugees, hosts)
Number of women employed though cooperatives supported by the project
Percentage increase in trade volumes using the Project road (dis-aggregated by refugees, hosts)
Percentage increase of beneficiaries who engaged in economic activities (dis-aggregated by refugees/ host community, female/male)
Percentage of women employed in construction and maintenance of Project road
Time of closure of Project road corridor in a year for movement of trucks
Increase in road user satisfaction on the Project road corridor (dis-aggregated by gender, refugees, hosts)
Percentage decrease in Vehicle Operating Costs on the Project road corridor dis-aggregated by buses, motorbikes, cars, and trucks (modes used by refugees/hosts and for trade)
Preparation and adoption of a CERC manual
Crash data entered into system, publicly reported, and used in decision making
Fully operational Environmental and Social Management System in place
Development and operationalization of a Road Accident Database Management System
Percentage decrease in travel time on the Project road corridor dis-aggregated by buses, motorbikes, and trucks (modes used by refugees/hosts and for trade)
Training and awareness campaigns in the Project area differentiated for refugee and host community audiences

target.value: Training and awareness campaigns conducted in all three districts that includes 50 percent refugees and 50 percent hosts; 50percent women and 50 percent men

baseline.value: To be developed for the Project road works

target.value: Plans are in place, root cause analysis of accidents at project site are undertaken, and mitigation measures are undertaken.
